title: "Nocturne" slanted uncial
content:
Hello... This one is weird, I think I had a \_similar\_ font, but it wasn't exact, plus, i lost it, so, yeah...   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142241im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24579.jpg)
author: toketsu

comments.content:
You might find something similar at Scriptorium ...   
   
 [http://www.fontcraft.com/scriptorium/sampler.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142241/http:/www.fontcraft.com/scriptorium/sampler.html)
Looks kind of like the bastard child of Benedict Uncial. \<\_\<

This logo could have been made with the free font [Mael](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142241/http:/www.dafont.com/en/theme.php?cat=303&page=3) 120% wider and slanted, the E a little modified at the end, and a custom N:   
   
 ![Mael](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142241im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24634.gif)

That sure looks very close to me! For comparison I took BJ's suggestion and looked at Scriptorium's collection. This was the closest I found (Allembert).   
 ![NocturneAllembertSim](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142241im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24638.gif)
The E from the "Scriptorium Allembert" font would go well to replace the 'E' in the 'Mael' font. Now, the mystery of the 'N' needs to be solved.
I would say it's a flipped "u" from Ignacio's find, with a little illustrator work...

\> Looks a bit like an amateurish Arthur Baker inspired   
design.   
   
I got this book of A. Baker and couldn't resist.   
   
 ![baker](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142241im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24723.jpg)   
Calligraphy by Arthur Baker. Dover
